item.title: Tidy: Potential fraud in Guess My Word
item.description: Motivation Like others, I’ve been surprised by my own addiction to Ryan Jones’s revival of “Guess My Word”. Data I grabbed a snapshot of the daily leaderboards from early 2020-01-21. For each participant, the number of guesses and the time to completion are recorded. In addition, entries are annotated with certain completion notes - first to respond, fewest guesses, fastest times, and “lucky”. ## Using an auto-discovered, cached token.

item.title: Extra point vs. two-point conversion
item.description: From the Riddler, a proposal for a new-and-improved post-touchdown extra-point system to defeat the repetitive extra point kicks. (Yeah!)

item.title: Makeover: Sugar consumption
item.description: Original visualization Source Article: BBC Data source: British Nutrition Foundation Additional: NHS guidelines Original survey: National Diet and Nutrition Survey Critique What works with this chart? The headline is attention-grabbing. Triple the recommendation?!? How is that possible? What doesn’t work with this chart? Age breakdown gets a lot of attention (17 groups!). But the message I pull down is that free sugar consumption is well above target for all ages.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
